Description: Rim fragment from North Ionian black-figured pottery lid with moulded ledge rim. Interior glazed orange-coloured. Exterior: bands of dots on edge of rim and between mouldings; three friezes separated by bands on top; from centre: lotus bud and flower; key pattern; black-figure griffins proceeding right with mixed filling ornament.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 224-5, no. 115)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.578)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (no. 961, pl. 109)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5721 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
